props.title: What is a variable in programming?
props.question: Which of the following best describes a variable?
options: A named container that stores a value in memory
A function that returns random values
A type of loop used in iteration
A keyword reserved by the programming language

metadata.title: Feedback Box
metadata.description: Shows correctness, explanation, and next steps

props.title: Correct!
props.message: You've correctly identified what a variable is.
props.explanation: A variable is a named container that stores a value in memory. Variables are fundamental to programming and allow us to store, retrieve, and manipulate data. They have a name, a type, and a value that can change during program execution.

metadata.title: Feedback Box

props.title: Excellent Work!
props.message: You correctly identified that Algorithm is not a primitive data type.
props.explanation: Primitive data types are the basic building blocks in programming and include Integer, Float, String, Boolean, and Char. An Algorithm is a procedure or set of rules for solving a problem, not a data type. Understanding data types is crucial for writing efficient and correct code.
